name: The Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't complain in any way about the Waterfront B&B accommodation in Baltimore. We loved the location, the friendliness of the staff, the bar area, the restaurant and the bedrooms. OK, the price was a little on the steep side but the accommodation we opted for was deluxe, with a very large bedroom, window facing towards the harbour, flat screen digital tv and a large walk in shower and toilet area. More like hotel accommodation than B&B really ! The first thing we noticed about the place was the relaxed atmosphere. The reception area was frequently unattended, and you had to make enquiries in the bar. That was fine by us. The staff are hard working and are friendly. We had dinner in the restaurant on our Saturday night and we both enjoying it, especially as we were seated at the window with the stunning harbour to look out at. We also loved the breakfast service. The full Irish breakfast was delicious, as was the cereal, fruit, pastries and yogurts on offer. The bar was very nice indeed and the service was exceptional. We are glad that we stayed here off season as I reckon the whole place would be packed during the summer months. Not a bad thing per se, but we love our peace and quiet. We'll be back here before the end of the year if the weather permits it. I really is an enchanting town and location to visit. A ferry ride to Cape Clear is also strongly recommended. I saw exotic birds, seals and even a porpoise on the ferry trip out !
reviews.title: I've no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Stayed here with our 2 young children for 4 nights. We were made to feel very welcome, which unfortunately isn't always the case when travelling with young children in Ireland. Room was beautiful, spacious and comfortable with views overlooking harbour. Huge spotless bathroom with separate bath and massive rain shower. Descret housekeeping, which was sometimes done after returing from breakfast. Breakfast was made to order with lovely views over the harbour. There was never a problem with individual orders for our little girl. We ate a few times in the bar which was lovely. Fresh fish, delicious pizzas reasonably priced in relaxed bar
reviews.title: Lovely stay
Nice setting but very very noisy hotel
reviews.text: with one free meal thrown in with our booking. Playground across the road. Would defnitely recommend/return. Had no issues with noise, it is a lively spot popular with locals so we just hope the noise levels from our kids didn't upset any guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a weekend in Baltimore as a birthday present for my fiancée. We booked into The Waterfront Hotel for two nights on 5th August 2011, Superior Suite, Room 14. On the first night of our stay we ate in the bar downstairs and had few drinks, and went to bed about 1 a.m. There was some noise during the night because Room 14 is located near the elevator which was to be expected. The following evening (Saturday) after a long day whale watching, we booked into the restaurant upstairs for a meal. We had a lovely dinner and went downstairs for a drink following our meal. By 11 p.m. we were shattered and headed up to bed. We were in bed at 11.30 p.m. when the loud banging music came from the bar and was clearly audible in our room. Initially we couldn’t understand where the music was coming from because there was no band in the bar.
reviews.title: lovely view, some friendly staff. but slapdash

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought it may be emanating from one of the rooms beneath us, so I put on my clothes and went to investigate. I was amazed to find the music was actually coming from the bar where a DJ was providing dance music for no more than five people. I told the barman our bedroom was hopping to the thud thud music and enquired as to what time the music would stop. I was told 1.30 a.m. (2 hrs later!). The barman asked the DJ to turn down the music, he obliged for no more than two seconds and then as if to make a clear point turned it back up even louder, which appeared to be an act of petty point scoring. I was extremely frustrated by this when I returned to my room I rang down to the bar but there was no answer. We are a young couple and enjoy late nights however this particular night we were exhausted and just wanted our sleep after a long day and a 3.5 hr journey home the next morning. We lay in bed for over 2 hrs waiting for the music to stop. It stopped at 1.45 a.m. We complained the following morning to the hotel receptionist who replied there had been several complaints about the music; she offered €20 off the bill as a token apology. We will NEVER stay at The Waterfront again. What is the point in having a disco for 5 people when there are paying customers trying to sleep? The weekend was a birthday present to my fiancée and I was really disappointed because I spent quite an amount of money in the hotel on dinners and drinks. I would strongly advise NOT to stay here.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious but a little chilly. Had great views over the harbour and the bay so you can watch the world go by. Baltimore is a working port so it is quite interesting. Limited menu was simple but well cooked.
reviews.title: Lovely harbour views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at The Waterfront, and if was even better than the last. The Baltimore area itself is fabulous, and The Waterfront is perfectly situated in the centre of the village, overlooking the harbour. The weekend atmosphere is great - there was music on Sunday afternoon, tables to sit at, and lots of very happy people! The accommodation is very good - we had a large, well-decorated and very comfortable room. We ate dinner in Jacob's Bar downstairs, and the pizzas were really good. Breakfast in the morning was a treat - it's served in a large room with floor to ceiling windows giving a gorgeous view over Roaring Water bay. The fries were freshly cooked to order, which slowed things down a bit but was worth it as they were very tasty. There was an inviting selection of food to choose from at the buffet too.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Waterfront is dog friendly, as is Jacob's Bar, which is a major plus for petowners!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing location overlooking Baltimore harbour and the square. Staff are just fabulous, food is incredible ( as is the wine- they have their own wine imported from Brittany, slurp) -room was fabulous too (room 9) with a partial view of the harbour and castle. We were insanely lucky to have a beautiful sunset each night- the dining room has floor to ceiling windows- and a fabulous table at the window for both breakfast and dinner. Can't rate this place highly enough which based on the divine staff, divine food and exceptional location is better than a lot of 5 star hotels I've stayed in!!
reviews.title: Top class location, bedroom and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This small hotel has greatstyle, the bedroom was well desiged to fit in the old building which has a lift! The view of the harbour from the room, the dining romm and the ground floor terrace were great and aded to the stay while the food, and the coffee, was excellent, all served by a very friendle and helpful staff.
reviews.title: can'twait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Waterfront is right in the heart of Baltimore Village with the most amazing view of the harbour. On check in I was informed I was being upgraded free of charge to a superior room as that night they were quiet. I ended up in Room 10, beautiful room with a huge bed and a wicked view.....couldn't ask for more. That afternoon (Sun) we went into the bar only to be treated to a traditional irish session. A barmaid recommended the Baltimore Pizza and mussels while we browsed the menu. Great choice !
reviews.title: Would highly recommend - great location, friendly staff & comfy bed !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had a great stay with friendly staff, good food and beautiful clean accommodation. I would certainly advise everyone to take advantage of such a unique spot in West Cork and if you like a relaxed friendly atmosphere which is good value for money stay at The Waterfront.
reviews.title: A very good base if visiting south west Cork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in Baltimore, and would recommend The Waterfront as a base there. It has everything that you desire at this price range. Our room was really nice, freshly decorated, very spacious, and facing onto the harbour. The food in The Lookout restaurant was nice, while the barfood/La Jolie Brise food was very good for the price.
reviews.title: Decent spot in the heart of Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this guesthouse for its location in the centre of the village. Overall it was a satisfactory spot. The room was clean and decent. However, I felt it lacked something, a bit of warmth you'd expect in most guesthouses and hotels. The lounge area was prettily decorated but was nonetheless uninviting. It is a fine place to use as a place to sleep but you may not wish to hang around here during the day. The building is full of long corridors and does not connect well as a whole. The breakfast is served in the adjoining restaurant until 12 noon with is a bonus.
reviews.title: Best view in Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the newer rooms over looking the harbour and the views are magnificent. The room was really spacious and clean. Breakfast was served in an adjoining cafe, the food is good but the options are a little limited and the cafe can get very busy. As the guesthouse is overlooking the harbour close to a number of great pubs it can get a little noisy at night but well worth if for the view!
reviews.title: Unbelievable hospitality.. unbelievable views
A Perfect Getaway
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a wonderful few days at the Waterfront in Baltimore. Upon checking in, we were shown to a lovely room with an incredible view overlooking Baltimore harbour. The staff couldn't have been more welcoming or more helpful, telling us how to make the most of Baltimore in the rain, and pointing us in the direction of the amazing Sherkin Island as soon as it cleared up. The food was lovely, the Guinness great. Couldn't recommend it enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to all at The Waterfront for a great weekend!! How beautiful to see the sunset on a gorgeous Autumn day and the sunrise overlooking Sherkin Island from our room. Instantly relaxing, great service and dog friendly too! Will be back down in Spring for more. Good for the soul........Thanks to all the staff.
reviews.title: A Room with a View - very relaxing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Waterfront for two days in August just after the famous Fastnet race and all the excitement of the capsizing of one of the super yachts. The waterfront bar was great fun and of course the food up stairs in the restaurant was superb, loved the fish dishes , fish being a favorite of mine. . Our room had a great view over the harbor and we found it was cleaned unobtrusively every day and the toiletries replaced or replenished. It is a lively place and we even met up with one of the lifeboat crew involved in the now famous rescue Yes we did find that the fun in the bar went on a bit at night, but that is part of the charm of the place, it seemed to be at the very center of village life. If you want to be on your own and have early nights this place is not for you, well not in the summer anyway. The Waterfront appeared to be owned and run by one family and we kept bumping into them in all capacities ( behind reception, behind the bar etc ) this made for a homely and familiar feel, even if they were a little overwhelmed at times such is the popularity of the place. We love our 4 and five star hotels, and its hard to class the waterfront as a B&B because of the restaurant and the fact that it has its own bar as well, but nevertheless as B&B's go this place gets top marks from us.
reviews.title: Top Marks for the Waterfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We come here quite a bit. The staff are so hard working, accommodating and kind. My father is elderly and a handful, and they always help out. The accommodation is homely, the setting is beautiful and everything is so relaxed and happy. It's a substantial drive for us to get here, but it is so worth it. We will be back again
reviews.title: Wonderful every time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: we have stopped here a few times when on passage to the uk great staff we were well looked after had a great ball with the locals the and the food in jacobs bar is wicked then after a few you can nip round the corner to bushes bar then back to jacbos for a night cap then up earl for a lovley breakfast
reviews.title: a stop over while on passage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here for the June Bank Holiday weekend and from the time we booked over the phone with ultra efficient and friendly Receptionist Wendy until the time we checked out we were welcomed and looked after like V.I.P.'s.
reviews.title: Stunning Views, Excellent Food & Friendly Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night we stayed in one of the Standard Sea View rooms which was bright and cheerful with lovely views of the square and harbour. Wendy upgraded us to one of their superior sea view rooms on our 2nd night which had stunning views of the whole area and islands. A lively Band played in the Square on Sunday evening and later we dined in their Lookout Restaurant with stunning views and delicious food. Breakfast each morning was served here by the ever pleasant Lisa who couldn't do enough for each guest.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a relaxing break in a great place. Looking forward to returning soon.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Waterfront is characterised by excellent food, staff that are very efficent, friendly and knowledgeable, and is in a great location.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice room and great value. Breakfast best I have had in any hotel in Ireland for a very long time.
reviews.title: Lovely Baltimore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last August whilst touring around West Cork and it was a lovely experience. As the name suggests, it's situated on the waterfront/marina in Baltimore and next to some nice little pubs and restaurants. The rooms were spacious and clean, but we booked too late to avail of a seafront room. We ate in the restaurants and it was very tasty. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Too good to be true (but it is)!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Right on the harbour in tiny, lovely Baltimore, Ireland, this hotel (and its associated pub and restaurant) was an amazing discovery. The room was perfect, excellent style, wooden floors, great view of the harbour, superb taste and lighting. Fantastic value for money too!
reviews.title: Lovely rooms and nice food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't believe it when they told us they served breakfast until 12.30! And, they did! What an amazing spread and amazing cooked breakfast included in the price of the room (fantastic bargain!). Service was superb and very friendly. Great to sit outside looking at Sherkin Island on a sunny day enjoying that wonderful breakfast and a hot pot of wonderful Irish tea!
reviews.title: Honeymoon at The Waterfront Guesthouse, Baltimore, Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Baltimore is very popular with the sailing set and the bar in front of the Waterfront hotel is the most lively place in town. The hotel is small. Parking can be a challenge although we were told that no on ever gets a parking ticket if they park on a yellow line! Our room was nicely appointed with pine furniture in the eaves of the building. Very comfortable beds. However all rooms face over the very lively square and so gets a lot of noise at night - so be prepared and take earplugs! We also had a very noisy group going to their rooms at around 2 am - so there should be sign asking guests to respect other guests and be quiet on their way to their rooms. The restaurant was ok - service a bit snooty. They would not give us a table for 2 at the window, saying the 3 empty tables were reserved. Although we were in the restaurant for an hour and a half and no one took those tables - so we could have had one if we'd agreed to stay for a max of 2 hours! Also the vegetable portions were very stingy! Overall, though a nice place to stay. And do Nic Slocum's whale watching trip - very good value - even if you don't see whales!
reviews.title: Very lively location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: We stayed at the waterfront for 2 nights mid July in a superior suite! What can I say the waterfront is not to be missed! There's was a beautiful fresh and airy feel the minute we walked in! The staff were extremely friendly explaining everything to us at check in and showing us to our room! the rooms are luxurious and spacious with all the facilities you would expect from a top class hotel. With tea/coffee facilities, flat screen tv, king size bed, a huge ensuite bathroom with a bath and a separate large walk in shower! But to top it all off a beautiful couch looking out on to the bay with Sherkin island in the distance! You'ii just never want to leave! You could sit there all day and watch the world go by. (the sun set not to be missed)
reviews.title: Fantastic fantastic fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: The breakfast was fantastic with plenty of choice. There is also various dining options. We enjoyed a superb meal in the look out. Both the sea food and staff were exceptional and the view amazing! All for a very affordable price! All in all weither it's a quiet few day of luxury or a action packed weekend your looking for the Waterfront is the place to stay! We just want to thank all the waterfront staff for making our stay so enjoyable. We will be back. Ben & kar
reviews.title: Fantastic guest house in an amazing location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: The waterfront is a real gem located in Baltimore harbour. There are 2 restaurants; the Jolie Brise & the lookout- both of which serve great quality food. We opted for a sea view superior room and we weren't dissapointed. The room was very large with beautiful furniture and a spacious bathroom with a bath and separate walk in shower. I would definitely come back to the waterfront
reviews.title: An overall brilliant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my stay in the waterfront I enjoyed a relaxing four day break with all the different amenities provided from the various establishments. On arrival I was greeted by a very friendly receptionist who very kindly showed us to our rooms. The rooms were superb and even provided brochures of the local attractions aswell as a kettle with tea and coffee, a flat screen tv and a exquisite en suite bathroom. My husband and I enjoyed the lovely scenic harbour view from our superior room.
reviews.title: Stunning location, very helpful staff and beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lets start with the negatives - there aren't any! This hotel is immaculate, the view of the harbour (from the front rooms) will make you want to sit in your room and just gaze out. The rooms are furnished to a higher standard than I had expected, each has a tv and a kettle (tea & coffee provided) and is en suite. For breakfast there is a huge choice, the menu shows what is on offer but you can have any combination you wish and nothing seems too much trouble (thanks Lisa). Before going into breakfast one morning we mentioned that we wished to go horse-riding, within 10 mins the receptionist came back to us with a list of bus times, the name and contact of the riding place etc -again service far beyond my/our expectations. The hotel has it's own bar and restaurants, the food is of a good standard but it is the staff who make the place what it is.
reviews.title: Perfect - Left us wanting to stay forever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I understand that this review will seem rather 'gushing' but I can not recommend the hotel highly enough - I always check out reviews before I book accommodation and am honest in my opinions. For a clean, friendly, value for money hotel look no further.
reviews.title: Ultimate escapism...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in May with our young toddler. This was our third visit to The Waterfront and once again we had a fantastic time. We did a boat trip over to sherkin island and rounded off the day in the Lookout restuarant enjoying excellent seafood. The staff are very welcoming and the rooms are luxurious and spacious. We were lucky enough to have a sea view and there is nothing nicer than waking up to that view! Excellent value for money.
reviews.title: A much needed break in a fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We had the most relaxing experience at The Waterfront from check to check out. From the onset the staff were extremely pleasent, courteous and most of all welcoming. Our room was beautifully appointed looking out into to the bay with the silouette of Sherkin Island in the backround. An evening sunset not to be missed!
reviews.title: Excellent location, exactly as in website, fantastic views....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed a superb meal in the lookout restaurant, beautifully fresh seafood to die for at prices which were very reasonable for the quality of the food and service, not to mention the view!
reviews.title: Gorgeous room, but just ok breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The bedroom was fantastic with amazing sea views of the harbour. The breakfast room also looked over the water. The staff were very nice and helpful especially when my grandmother became ill on one of the mornings. The only let down is the noise in the rooms from not only the bar downstairs and the crowds overflowing onto the streets at night, but also noise from adjoining rooms. You could here peoples voices and the shower sounded like it was in our own room!
reviews.title: Great views from the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: We stayed here during the quiet period and got a good deal so was great value for money. The room was spacious with a very large bed and great views out over the harbour. Service was good and everyone was friendly, downstairs was a restaurant and pub with a nice open fire. Definitely worth a stay.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had an enjoyable stay in November. Hotel has great views overlooking harbour and islands. Restaurant has huge floor to ceilings windows giving a spectacular view at breakfast time. You can watch the ferry coming in from your room and walk to it in order to go to Sherkin or Cape Clear. Bar was fine and food was good.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant hotel with well appointed rooms, the staff are friendly and courteous and the hotel is in a great location so you can easily explore the surrounding area.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is decidedly average and each table is "adorned" with what must be regarded as the worst ketchup available in Ireland in my opinion, Kandee Ketchup.
reviews.title: Faultless again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Congratulations to all of the staff at this wonderful hotel. Nothing is too much trouble for them. The open plan bar and cafe are a delight, as is the restaurant upstairs with the scenic views. We requested a quiet room, and it defies belief how the receptionist was able to conjure one up, given that there are always so many people sitting out at the front of the bar and cafes. Television has limited Sky digital. The bathroom is awesome. The power shower is excellent. Breakfast service is excellent. Try the pizza in the bar. It's delicious. Accommodation is dear, but it is about right for peak season. The surroundings in Baltimore are gorgeous. Walk up to the Beacon. The views are stunning. Not to be attempted at night, or with children. It would be dangerous. My main praise goes to the staff of the Waterfront, who are so kind and considerate. My father is elderly, and they are always so kind to him. I will be back, several times over. Baltimore, Sherkin and Cape Clear are all wonderful
reviews.title: The staff really make this place what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff warm and friendly. The view was so stunning we couldn't see the need for a tv in the room. Spotlessly clean, with tiled floors. Great bathroom with terrific shower. I can think of nothing to moan about. We will certainly return.
reviews.title: Fabulous Room. Fabulous View. Fabulous Food. Fabulous Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: Baltimore itself lovely with a great atmosphere through day and night.
reviews.title: Nice location for hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well located hotel/bb. Greeted very well upon arrival given information on the area. Room was a little small and we were at the back of the hotel so we missed out on the ocean view. Noisey in the mornings out the back with guys trailing rubbish and recycling bottles in the bins. We were up early anyhow taking in the super breakfast. We stayed for two nights which was spot on as things to do are limited apart from visiting the nearest island
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great buzz, amazing seafood and fish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Baltimore village but ate at Jacob's Bar every second day. Why? 59 delicious mussels for 13.50 euro, huge portion of fish of the day (freshly off the boat) and chips for the same price. The pizza was very nice too, very thin bases. Jacob's Bar is at the square overlooking Baltimore harbour, the place is buzzing at the weekend, full of locals and visitors. The view of the sunset is beautiful, the food is great and very reasonable. You can't really ask for more!
reviews.title: fabulous room with stunning view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was travelling from Kerry to Cork with my young family and we decided to stop off in Baltimore at The Waterfont for the night. The views from the guesthouse are magnificent looking out to Baltimore Bay and Sherkin Island beyond.
reviews.title: Lovely spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have a two year old and 6 month old and the staff were so friendly and accomodating to our needs. We in fact used a local babysitter recommended by the owners and my wife and I enjoyed an uninterrupted dinner below in Jacobs bar.
reviews.title: Pure heaven in Baltimore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was fantastic - we dived in to a platter of seafood! We enjoyed breakfast in the lookout restaurant which boasts the best views of the bay. Again the staff couldn't do enough for us. Looking forward to going back and using it as a base to visit the surrounding islands.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Just stayed 2 nights with my husband and 2 boys who are aged 4 and 10months. Our room was spectacular wonderful sea view and it was enormous. It was really well decorated and more like a five star hotel. Plenty of room for our cot and they very kindly put a single bed in for our 4 year old. The bar food was excellant and the kids loved the ice cream bar. Staff were very helpful and helped us out with any questions we had. We will be back again!
reviews.title: Bad service

description: The Waterfront, Baltimore, is a relaxed family run establishment comprising of rooms, 2 restaurants (one is open all year the other is seasonal) and a bar.We are located right in the centre of the village of Baltimore overlooking Baltimore Bay and the Islands. We have a selection of Standard and Superior rooms available, most with Sea View.All our rooms are bright and spacious. It is owned by the Jacob family who look forward to welcoming you during your trip to the beautiful Baltimore village in the South West of Ireland.
